1.rationale:
Thinking out loud:

My current position is (6,9).  The closest apple is at (8,5). To get there I need to move towards it.  There are no immediate obstacles, but I need to be mindful of the enemy snake at (1,8).  Moving up is safe for now.

Next turn strategy: Prioritize getting to the closest apple. Then, look for ways to safely create a longer snake to block the other player.

Next Move: UP

2.rationale:
Reviewing the board and locations:

• Our snake (#2) is at (1,8). Adjacent moves we can make are UP to (1,9), DOWN to (1,7), LEFT to (0,8), or RIGHT to (2,8).

• There’s an apple at (2,7) which is the closest: its Manhattan distance from (1,8) is 2 (|2–1| + |7–8|). If we move RIGHT, we go from (1,8) to (2,8) and then we’d be one move away (DOWN) to eat the apple; if we move DOWN, we move to (1,7) and then RIGHT to the apple. Both options are safe.

• The enemy snake (#1) at (6,9) is far away and isn’t a threat now, and none of our options would run into walls or our own body.

For this turn, moving RIGHT from (1,8) gets us closer to the apple at (2,7).

Next move: RIGHT.
